clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Narrative Exposure Therapy Among Refugee Children and Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: How to Help War-affected Children and Adolescents: the Role of Memory Functions in Therapeutic Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to understand how war trauma affects children's and adolescents' memory functions and mental health, and whether Narrative Exposure Therapy is effective in enhancing optimal memory functions and alleviating mental health problems. The study analyzes the mental health and cognitive and emotional healing mechanisms of therapeutic intervention among war-affected children and adolescents.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-traumatic Stress as measured by Revised Impact of Event Scale
Depression as measured by Depression Self-Rating Scale for Children
Psychological Distress as measured by Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire
Resilience as measured by Child and Youth Resilience Measure
Cognitive Performance as measured by Working Memory Test Battery for Children

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Traumatic Memory as measured by Trauma Memory Quality Questionnaire
Trauma Related Cognitions as measured by Children's Post Traumatic Cognitions Inventory
General functioning of autobiographical memory as measured by reported life events

other_outcome.measure: Subjective distress during therapy measured by Subjective Units of Distress Scale
Peritraumatic Dissociation measured by Peritraumatic Dissociative Experiences Questionnaire

arm_group.description: For the intervention group receiving Narrative Exposure Therapy treatment, the intervention will last for approximately three months and include 10-12 weekly sessions of 60-90 minutes. The course of the intervention will follow the NET manual (Schauer et al., 2011).
For the TAU control group, participants will receive the usual care for posttraumatic stress symptoms currently offered by each unit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 9-17 years old
- has spent some part of her/his life living in a country where organized violence was taking place, or at a refugee camp
- suffers from significant stress symptoms thought be trauma-related
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute psychosis
- intellectual disability

facility.name: Family Counselling Centre of the City of Tampere
Psychiatric Clinic for Traumatized Children at Tampere University Hospital
